FuncDef:
The 802.1p-to-vpn command enables a BAS interface to transmit packets to different VPNs based on 802.1p priorities of the packets.
The undo 802.1p-to-vpn command disables a BAS interface from transmitting packets to different VPNs based on 802.1p priorities of the packets.
By default, BAS interfaces do not transmit packets to different VPNs based on 802.1p priorities of the packets.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Service packets carry 802.1p values to identify their priorities. The BRAS can identify service priorities based on the 802.1p values of received Layer 2 service packets and transmit the service packets to corresponding VPNs. To allow this, run the 802.1p-to-vpn command to enable a BAS interface to transmit packets to different VPNs based on 802.1p priorities of the packets, and also bind VPN instances to different 802.1p priorities.
Prerequisites
Layer 2 subscriber access has been configured for the BAS interface using the access-type layer2-subscriber command.
Follow-up Procedure
Run the 802.1p binding vpn-instance command to bind a VPN instance to an 802.1p priority.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
